articles.title: Kim Jong Un Inspects KPA Fishery Station
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Inspects KPA Fishery Station
Pyongyang, December 15 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, chairman of the Workers' Party of Korea, chairman of the State Affairs Commission of the DPRK and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army (KPA), inspected Fishery Station No. 15 of the KPA.
					 The fishery station, which was remodeled and updated to meet the requirements of the age of knowledge-based economy and a highly civilized socialist nation, made an unprecedentedly big fish haul.
					
					 In November last year Kim Jong Un had inspected the fishery station.
					
					 At that time he highly praised the fishermen of the station for catching thousands of tons of fish in a few days, advancing the yearly goal to be attained by the station in catching fish in a short span of time.
					
					 He also personally initiated the project to turn the station into a modern fishery station and gave solution to all issues arising in doing so.
					
					 Thanks to the dynamic efforts made by the officials, employees and soldier-builders of KPA unit and the fishery station, it was successfully remodeled and made an unheard-of big fish haul.
					
					 Warmly shaking hands with the commanding officers of the unit and officials of the fishery station, he praised them for turning it into a modern one to be impeccable in the distant future while making a big fish haul.
					
					 On a fishing boat which returned to port with a big haul flag, he shook hands with its fishermen, highly praising their efforts.
					
					 Noting the 5th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's demise will be observed in a few days, Kim Jong Un said what comes across in his mind when he remembers Kim Jong Il whom he misses very much is the document on fish supply to the Pyongyang citizens signed by Kim Jong Il at night of the last day of his great life, adding he read the document several times that day, too, and visited the KPA fishery station as he thought that Kim Jong Il would be pleased if fish caught by the KPA would be sent to the Pyongyang citizens.
					
					 Going round various places of the station, he learned in detail about the progress made in its updating, fish catching, storage and supply.
					
					 Watching the employees working at the processing workshop, he indicated the tasks to put all the processing processes on a high streamlined and robotized basis and thus save manpower and strictly ensure hygiene.
					
					 Feasting his eyes on the bales of frozen fish piled up high, he said with a broad smile that he was very pleased and felt relieved of his pent-up fatigue after being told that 200 grams of fish can be supplied to each soldier every day until September next year with fish in storage.
					
					 At the combined control room, he learned in detail about the systems of maritime environment information analysis and assessment, maritime commanding, fish processing equipment control and observation of electricity.
					
					 He went round the room for the education in the revolutionary history, the room dedicated to the history of the fishery station, the cultural hall, the sci-tech knowledge dissemination room and the sanatorium.
					
					 Noting all production buildings and leisure facilities were designed well and built in high quality and fishermen would like them very much, he said that he would make sure that dwellings for the employees of the station would be excellently built next year.
					
					 He gave the station instructions to be served as guidelines for its management and operation.
					
					 Noting that he went round the fishery station with satisfaction, he said that he became more firmly convinced through the remarkable successes made in the field of fishery of the KPA this year that the history of big fish hauls can be given steady continuity.
					
					 Expressing expectation and belief that the officials and employees of Fishery Station No. 15 of the KPA would take the lead in carrying out the fishing policy of the Party by catching more fish next year, too, he had a photo session with them.
					
					 He was accompanied by KPA Vice Marshal Hwang Pyong So, director of the General Political Bureau of the KPA, and Army Col. General So Hong Chan, first vice-minister of the People's Armed Forces.

articles.title: Message to Kim Jong Un from Syrian President
articles.content:
Message to Kim Jong Un from Syrian President
Pyongyang, December 15 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, chairman of the State Affairs Commission of the DPRK, received a message from Bashar Al-Assad, president of Syria, on Dec. 13.
					 The message said that the Syrian Arab people are sharing sorrow with the Korean leadership and the friendly Korean people on the occasion of the 5th anniversary of demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 It noted that they are recalling the efforts made by Kim Jong Il and the exploits he performed by leading the Korean people, firmly adhering to his ideology, line and principles of resistance during the arduous days.
					
					 He greatly contributed to making the DPRK achieve progress and development and win a great victory in the struggle to defend socialism and the nation, it said.
					
					 The message hoped that Kim Jong Un would complete the struggle for the Party, revolution, the country and its people guided by Kim Jong Il, the eternal leader of the Workers' Party of Korea, and the Korean revolution whose basic mission is to realize global independence.

articles.title: Congratulations to Ghanaian President-Elect
articles.content:
Congratulations to Ghanaian President-Elect
Pyongyang, December 15 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, on Thursday sent a congratulatory message to Nana Akufo-Addo, president-elect of Ghana.
					 The message extended congratulations to him upon assuming the heavy responsibility of the president thanks to the deep trust of the people in the recent election held in Ghana.
					
					 It wished him success in his work for the country's prosperity, expressing the belief that the relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries would grow stronger.

articles.title: Delegation of Ministry of Land and Maritime Transport Back Home
articles.content:
Delegation of Ministry of Land and Maritime Transport Back Home
Pyongyang, December 15 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the DPRK Ministry of Land and Maritime Transport led by Minister Kang Jong Gwan came back home Thursday after attending the 3rd Asia-Pacific regional ministerial conference on transport held in Moscow.

articles.title: Floral Basket to Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il from Nigerian President
articles.content:
Floral Basket to Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il from Nigerian President
Pyongyang, December 15 (KCNA) -- Muhammadu Buhari, president and commander-in-chief of the Armed Forces of Nigeria, sent a floral basket to the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill on the occasion of the 5th anniversary of demise of Kim Jong Il.
					 The floral basket was placed at the statues of the great leaders on Thursday.

articles.title: Canadian Foreign Ministry Delegation Visits DPRK
articles.content:
Canadian Foreign Ministry Delegation Visits DPRK
Pyongyang, December 15 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Foreign Ministry of Canada led by Sarah Taylor, director general for North Asia and Oceania at Global Affairs Canada, visited the DPRK from Dec. 13 to 15. 
					 During the stay, the delegation paid a courtesy call on Han Song Ryol, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs of the DPRK and met with Choe Son Hui, director general for North American Affairs of the Foreign Ministry to discuss the issue of developing the DPRK-Canada relations in conformity with the aspiration and demands of the two peoples and the matters of mutual concern including the issue of Rim Hyon Su, a Canadian citizen.
					
					 The delegation had a meeting with Rim Hyon Su who was sentenced to life hard labor for state subversion.

articles.title: Foreign Guests Visit Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Foreign Guests Visit Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
Pyongyang, December 15 (KCNA) -- The Economic and Commercial Councilors Corps here and staff members of the missions of UNDP, WFP, WHO, FAO, and the United Nations Population Fund in the DPRK visited the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill Thursday on the occasion of the 5th anniversary of demise of Kim Jong Il.
					 They placed floral baskets before the statues of the great leaders and paid tribute to them.

articles.title: Chinese and Koreans Related to Anti-Japanese Revolutionary Struggle Here
articles.content:
Chinese and Koreans Related to Anti-Japanese Revolutionary Struggle Here
Pyongyang, December 15 (KCNA) -- Families of those related to the anti-Japanese revolutionary struggle arrived here Thursday to commemorate the fifth anniversary of demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 Among them are family members of Zhang Weihua, a Chinese anti-Japanese revolutionary martyr,  Chai Shiying, Jiang Zihua and Liu Tong-shi, Chinese related to the anti-Japanese revolutionary struggle, Pak Kil Song, a Korean anti-Japanese revolutionary martyr in China, So Sun Ok, an anti-Japanese revolutionary fighter in China, and Son Won Thae, an overseas Korean related to the anti-Japanese revolutionary struggle.
					
					 Arriving also were family members of Hu Zhenyi, a Chinese related to the anti-Japanese revolutionary struggle.

articles.title: Delegation of Koreans in Japan Here
articles.content:
Delegation of Koreans in Japan Here
Pyongyang, December 15 (KCNA) -- A delegation of Koreans in Japan led by O Hyong Jin, permanent adviser to the Research Institute on History of Korean Residents in Japan, arrived here Thursday to attend the memorial service for leader Kim Jong Il on the fifth anniversary of his demise.

articles.title: Chief Executive Officer of Inter Mediate Leaves
articles.content:
Chief Executive Officer of Inter Mediate Leaves
Pyongyang, December 15 (KCNA) -- Jonathan Powell, chief executive officer of the Inter Mediate, and his companion left here Thursday.

articles.title: Meetings of Working People's Organizations Observe Demise Anniversary of Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Meetings of Working People's Organizations Observe Demise Anniversary of Kim Jong Il
Pyongyang, December 15 (KCNA) -- Working people's organizations in the DPRK held oath-taking meetings on Thursday with the fifth anniversary of demise of leader Kim Jong Il as an occasion.
					 Youth and students met in front of the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill, agricultural workers and members of the Union of Agricultural Workers of Korea (UAWK) at the Unha Co-op Farm in Onchon County, Nampho City and officials and members of the Socialist Women's Union of Korea (SWUK) at the Hall of Women.
					
					 Present there were Choe Ryong Hae, vice-chairman of the C.C., Workers' Party of Korea, officials concerned, officials of the youth league, the UAWK and the SWUK, youths and students, agricultural workers and members of the UAWK and SWUK.
					
					 At the oath-taking meeting of youths and students, the participants, led by Jon Yong Nam, first secretary of the Central Committee of the youth league, swore an oath to remain loyal to supreme leader Kim Jong Un's Songun revolutionary leadership, true to the behests of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Reports were made to be followed by speeches at the meetings of agricultural workers and members of the UAWK, officials and member of the SWUK. 
					
					 The reporters and speakers praised the whole life of Kim Jong Il as that of an outstanding leader who opened a new history of building a powerful socialist country, giving steady continuity to the bloodline of the Juche revolution that struck deep roots in Mt. Paektu.
					
					 They called for turning out as one in the struggle to devotedly carry out the behests of Kim Jong Il with the unshakable faith that he will always be with us.

articles.title: Tribute Paid to Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Tribute Paid to Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
Pyongyang, December 15 (KCNA) -- A memorial delegation of Koreans in Japan visited the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill here on Thursday.
					 The delegation laid bunches of flowers before the statues of the great leaders and paid tribute to them.

articles.title: Chief of AINDF Pyongyang Mission Praises Kim Jong Il's Feats for National Reunification
articles.content:
Chief of AINDF Pyongyang Mission Praises Kim Jong Il's Feats for National Reunification
Pyongyang, December 15 (KCNA) -- Jo Il Min, chief of the Pyongyang Mission of the Anti-Imperialist National Democratic Front, was interviewed by KCNA on Thursday with the approach of the fifth anniversary of demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 The past five years during which the Koreans missed Kim Jong Il very much were a period in which they keenly felt what great man the nation had as the leader of reunification, he said, and went on:
					
					 The south Koreans always remember the beaming image of General Kim Jong Il who shed bright rays for reunification across south Korea.
					
					 Thanks to his invariable will for reunification and patriotic courageous decision, the south-north summits took place and the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration were adopted and the new era of independent reunification guided by the idea of By Our Nation Itself was ushered in.
					
					 The Koreans still recollect the joyful days when severed railways and road were reconnected and sea route and airways were opened between the north and the south and reunification events common to the nation and south-north economic cooperation were brisk.
					
					 General Kim Jong Il opened a rosy prospect for achieving the national independence and realizing the cause of great national unity and had led the Koreans to the reunification movement with warm compatriotism until the last moments of his life.
					
					 That is why personages of political and social circles and patriotic masses in the south still now speak highly of the distinguished leadership ability and boundless magnanimity of Kim Jong Il who put the south-north relations of mistrust and confrontation on the track of reconciliation and unity and opened a new phase of great national unity, praising him as "the greatest patriot", "the most ardent nationalist" and "the best general".
					
					 His whole life is, indeed, the history of devotion made by the peerless patriot as he recorded a brilliant chapter in the history of the movement for national reunification.
					
					 His exploits will always go down in the history of the eternally prospering nation as he wisely led the reunification movement of the nation with his outstanding idea and leadership.

articles.title: Immortal Feats for Building Revolutionary Militia Forces
articles.content:
Immortal Feats for Building Revolutionary Militia Forces
Pyongyang, December 15 (KCNA) -- In the DPRK, the Worker-Peasant Red Guards (WPRG) is one of the self-reliant national defence forces, together with the Korean People's Army.
					 Members of the WPRG have fulfilled their sacred duty in building a socialist economic power and defending the country, each taking a rifle in one hand and a hammer or sickle in the other.
					
					 President Kim Il Sung created the tradition of building militia forces in the flames of anti-Japanese armed struggle.
					
					 Leader Kim Jong Il carried on the President's idea of building the Juche-oriented militia forces to further strengthen the WPRG.
					
					 He made public such famous works as "The Worker-Peasant Red Guards Is Powerful Militia Forces of Our Party" and "On the Invincibility of the All-People Defence System" to prove in a scientific way that the all-people defence system set forth by the President was a new-type defence system established in the DPRK for the first time in history.
					
					 He also indicated the tasks and ways for further strengthening the WPRG.
					
					 In late January Juche 51 (1962) when visiting Ohyon-ri in Yonan County, South Hwanghae Province with the President, Kim Jong Il gave precious instructions for intensifying combat and political training of WPRG members to defend their birthplaces and working sites.
					
					 In his days at Kim Il Sung University, he personally took part in a WPRG column of the military parade held on the occasion of the 30th founding anniversary of the Korean People's Army.
					
					 He also guided the training of WPRG members and wisely led the work to fully establish the well-organized commanding and training systems and revolutionary military climate in the WPRG.
					
					 In September Juche 100 (2011), the last year of his great life, he saw to it that the 63rd anniversary of the DPRK was splendidly celebrated with the WPRG parade to demonstrate the validity and vitality of the military line of self-reliant defence of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) and the great strength of militia forces all over the world.
					
					 Now, the WPRG is displaying its might as the revolutionary armed forces of the WPK under the wise leadership of Marshal Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Ten Best Players for 2016 Selected in DPRK
articles.content:
Ten Best Players for 2016 Selected in DPRK
Pyongyang, December 15 (KCNA) -- Ten best players for Juche 105 (2016) were selected in the DPRK.
					 They are Om Yun Chol, Rim Jong Sim, Ri Se Gwang, Kim Song I, Kim Song Guk, Pak Myong Won, Pak Chol, Kim Hye Song, Jon Chol and Kang Un Ju.
					
					 During the 31st Olympic Games, Rim Jong Sim won a gold medal in the women's 75kg weightlifting event and Ri Se Gwang in the men's vault of gymnastics. And Om Yun Chol bagged a silver medal in the men's 56kg weightlifting event, Kim Song I a bronze in the women's single table tennis event and Kim Song Guk in the men's 50m pistol event.
					
					 Pak Myong Won took the second place in the adult men's individual 10 meter moving target shooting and 10 meter moving target mixed shooting events and the third in the 50 meter moving target mixed shooting event of the 2016 World Moving Target Shooting Championship.
					
					 Pak Chol placed the first in the Mangyongdae Prize International Marathon and Kim Hye Song the second in the half marathon of the Great Eastern Women's Run held in Singapore.
					
					 Jon Chol made a new national record in archery event of the Mangyongdae Prize Sports Games, and Kang Un Ju in archery event at the Sports Contest for Pochonbo Torch Prize and renewed her record in the 13th People's Games.

articles.title: Essential Oil Nano-Dispersant Developed in DPRK
articles.content:
Essential Oil Nano-Dispersant Developed in DPRK
Pyongyang, December 15 (KCNA) -- The Pyongyang Essential Oils Research Center in the DPRK developed a new kind of essential oil nano-dispersant for killing harmful insects.
					It has been spread over 60,000 hectares of orchards in recent three years, ensuring over 95 percent of insecticidal rate.
					
					 In this regard, Choe Tung Gwang, director of the center, told KCNA:
					
					 The nano-dispersant, the first of its kind in the country, is made with locally available raw materials 100 percent and its production method is quite different from world-known ones.
					
					 Researchers of the center settled technical problems arising in raising the insecticidal rate of the dispersant, including those of killing insect eggs and raising its infiltrative and transitional effect.

articles.title: "State-Compiled History Textbooks" Rejected in S. Korea
articles.content:
"State-Compiled History Textbooks" Rejected in S. Korea
Pyongyang, December 15 (KCNA) -- A network against "state-compiled textbooks", composed of more than 460 civic, social and history organizations, and opposition parties of south Korea Monday held an emergency seminar at the "National Assembly" at which they disclosed the injustice of the screened copies of "state-compiled history textbooks" made public by the puppet authorities, according to the south Korean Yonhap News.
					 Speakers at the seminar warned that if the regime forcibly applies the "state-compiled history textbooks", they would launch a campaign against their sale.

articles.title: Bird Flu Spreads in S. Korea
articles.content:
Bird Flu Spreads in S. Korea
Pyongyang, December 15 (KCNA) -- Bird flu occurred in Chongju, North Chungcheong Province and Raju, South Jolla Province, according to the south Korean KBS on Tuesday.
					 In recent days bird flu spreads to different areas of south Korea and as of Monday, more than 9,817,000 chickens and ducks were buried and another millions of them are to be buried.

articles.title: Scheme to Deploy THAAD Rejected in S. Korea
articles.content:
Scheme to Deploy THAAD Rejected in S. Korea
Pyongyang, December 15 (KCNA) -- A parliamentary spokesman for the Minju Party of south Korea held a press conference at the "National Assembly" on Dec. 13 to reject the puppet Defense Ministry's scheme to deploy THAAD.
					 Noting that the ministry agreed to round off the THAAD deployment in May next year, he said that this should be reconsidered.
					
					 The THAAD deployment is not what the regime impeached by the people should do at haphazard, he added.

articles.title: Documents Proving Choe Sun Sil as Wire-Puller of Park Geun Hye Discovered
articles.content:
Documents Proving Choe Sun Sil as Wire-Puller of Park Geun Hye Discovered
Pyongyang, December 15 (KCNA) -- Massive documents were discovered in south Korea, proving that traitor Park Geun Hye has been manipulated by Choe Sun Sil, little short of a shaman, according to the south Korean Yonhap News on Dec. 11.
					 In the course of searches into Choe and those related with her by the prosecution, many documents sent by Jong Ho Song, first vice-chief of Chongwadae, to Choe before their presentation to Park Geun Hye were found.
					
					 They included information about persons informally designated by Park for Cabinet in the early days of her office and declaration of their nomination.
					
					 They comprised even the schedule of Park for junket to other countries.
					
					 The fact that thirty documents were handled through Choe in 2012 was also opened to public.

articles.title: Candlelight Meeting of Koreans in New York
articles.content:
Candlelight Meeting of Koreans in New York
Pyongyang, December 15 (KCNA) -- Koreans residing in New York held a candlelight meeting in Manhattan on Dec. 9 in demand of the resignation of Park Geun Hye, according to Minjok Thongsin, an online newspaper of Koreans in the U.S.
					 At the meeting, speakers declared that candlelight action should continue till a society in which the 70-years-old evil abuses are eradicated and popular masses emerge masters in south Korea has been built.
					
					 They held that only by doing so, it is possible to prove the truth behind the ferry Sewol disaster and nullify the "agreement" on sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army, a military agreement with Japan and the "state-compiled history textbooks".
					
					 They declared that overseas Koreans would carry on their candlelight actions in the future, too.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Remembered in Russia
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Remembered in Russia
Pyongyang, December 15 (KCNA) -- An event took place in Moscow on Dec. 8 to commemorate the 5th anniversary of demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 The event comprised of Korean book and photo exhibition, film show, remembrance concert and book-donating ceremony.
					
					 On display in its venue were photos showing the revolutionary activities of Kim Jong Il and supreme leader Kim Jong Un. Also, there were works of the peerlessly great men of Mt. Paektu and books and photos introducing the true picture of the DPRK.
					
					 The participants watched a Korean film "Leader Kim Jong Il Meets with President Putin of the Russian Federation".
					
					 Then there took place a remembrance concert at which Russian artistes presented "Attraction and Reverence" and other Korean songs and Russian songs on patriotism.
					
					 The curator of the national hall of the Moscow City government said that Kim Jong Il had a historic meeting with Putin in the first year of the new century and thus opened a new chapter in the development of the Russian-Korean friendship and contributed to ensuring the world peace and security.
					
					 At the event, the works of the peerless great men of Mt. Paektu and books showing their greatness and the DPRK's truce picture were conveyed to the curator.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Russia
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Russia
Pyongyang, December 15 (KCNA) -- A committee for remembering leader Kim Jong Il was formed by the Maritime Territorial branch of the All-Russia Women's Council "Hope of Russia" on Monday.
					 T. N. Esikova, chairwoman of the branch, was elected chairwoman of the committee.
					
					 The committee decided to hold political and cultural events in praise of the revolutionary career and exploits of Kim Jong Il on the occasion of the fifth anniversary of his demise.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Libya
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Libya
Pyongyang, December 15 (KCNA) -- A Libyan committee for remembering leader Kim Jong Il on the fifth anniversary of his demise was formed in Tarabulus on Dec. 11.
					 The general director of Sunbula International Friendship Club who is chairman of the Libya-Korea Friendship Association was elected chairman of the remembrance committee.
					
					 The committee decided to organize political and cultural functions such as remembrance meeting, film show and photo exhibition in praise the revolutionary career and exploits of Kim Jong Il on the above-said occasion.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Russia
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Russia
Pyongyang, December 15 (KCNA) -- A committee for remembering leader Kim Jong Il was formed by the Maritime Territorial branch of the Youth Guards, an all-Russia social body affiliated to the United Russia Party, on Dec. 12.
					 Ragunov, head of the branch, was elected as chairman of the committee.
					
					 The committee decided to organize political and cultural events for praising the revolutionary career and feats of Kim Jong Il on the occasion of the 5th anniversary of his demise.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Work Published in Russia
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Work Published in Russia
Pyongyang, December 15 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un's work "Let Us Add Eternal Brilliance to Comrade Kim Jong Il's Great Idea and Achievements of the Songun Revolution" was brought out in booklet by the Nakhodka Format Publishing House of Russia on Dec. 8 to commemorate the fifth anniversary of demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 The work, published on August 25, Juche 102 (2013), deals with the Songun revolutionary leadership feats of Kim Jong Il and the essence and originality of the Songun revolutionary idea and indicates the tasks for successfully accomplishing the cause of the Songun revolution.

articles.title: Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Demise Observed in China, Iran
articles.content:
Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Demise Observed in China, Iran
Pyongyang, December 15 (KCNA) -- A Chinese magazine and an Iranian newspaper carried special write-ups on the fifth anniversary of demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 The November issue of the Chinese Hong Kong magazine International Link carried some articles illustrated with a portrait of smiling Kim Jong Il and photos of Kim Jong Il and supreme leader Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The magazine, in an article titled "White Snow and Kim Jong Il", explained the philosophy of snow that runs through the life of Kim Jong Il, saying that he was born in Mt. Paektu in snowy February and left the Korean people in snowy December.
					
					 It said that he devoted all his life to the people's happiness and showed warm care for all people. 
					
					 In another article the magazine told that the exploits Kim Jong Il performed to reliably defend socialism and advance it triumphantly are being creditably carried forward by supreme leader Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The Dec. 5th issue of the Iranian newspaper The Iran News, in an article titled "Eternal leader of the Korean people" illustrated with an image of smiling Kim Jong Il, stressed that he would be always praised as the eternal leader of the Korean people.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un recorre Empresa Pesquera No. 15 de Ejercito Popular de Corea
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un recorre Empresa Pesquera No. 15 de Ejercito Popular de Corea
Pyongyang, 15 de diciembre (ACNC) -- Kim Jong Un, Presidente del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y del Comite de Estado de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea dirigio en el terreno la Empresa Pesquera No. 15 del EPC, que fue remodelada y modernizada conforme a la demanda de la epoca de la economia basada en intelectual y el pais civilizado socialista y logro sin precedente una gran cosecha de pescado.
					En noviembre del ano pasado, el Presidente estuvo en esta empresa pesquera donde aprecio mucho los meritos de los pescadores que solo en unos dias pescaron miles de toneladas de pescados y presento la meta anual de produccion de pescados a ser alcanzada en corto plazo. Y tuvo la iniciativa directa de convertir la empresa en la moderna base productiva y resolvio todos los problemas pendientes en la obra de remodelacion y modernizacion.
					
					Gracias a los dinamicos esfuerzos de los funcionarios, empleados y los constructores militares de la unidad y la empresa, esta base productiva fue remodelada magnificamente en breve tiempo y logro abundante cosecha de pescados.
					
					Apretando una tras otra las manos de los comandantes de la unidad y los funcionarios de la empresa pesquera, el Presidente elogio los esfuerzos de ellos diciendo que  pescaron mucho y remodelaron excelentemente la empresa como la moderna base pesquera.
					
					Y subio personalmente al barco pesquero que regreso con gran cantidad de pescados y tomo cordialmente las manos de los pescadores, evaluando sus trabajos y averiguando las dificultades.
					
					Dijo que despues de unos dias acogeremos el aniversario 5 del fallecimiento del Dirigente Kim Jong Il, al recordar a este no puede olvidar el documento sobre el suministro de pescados a los capitalinos, firmado por el Dirigente en la noche de ultimo dia de su vida. Y continuo que lo lei hoy tantas veces y vino a esta base productiva de pescados del EPC pensando que el Dirigente se alegrara mucho si suministra los pescados capturados por el EPC a los habitantes capitalinos.
					
					Recorrio varios lugares de la empresa para estudiar en detalle el estado de remodelacion, los resultados de pesca y la conservacion y suministro de pescados.
					
					En la fabrica de elaboracion presencio el trabajo de los empleados y presento las tareas de realizar la automatizacion perfecta de todos los procesos y garantizar perfectamente la seguridad higienica ahorrando manos de obra.
					
					Se puso satisfecho al enterarse de que los depositos frigorificos estan llenos de pescados a ser suministrados cada dia los 200g de pescado a cada militar hasta septiembre del proximo ano.
					
					Recorriendo la sala de control combinado, el Presidente averiguo detalladamente los sistemas de analisis y estimacion de informaciones sobre el ambiente del mar, el mando maritimo, el control de equipos de procesamiento de pescados y el control de electricidad.
					
					Y paso revista por la sala de educacion en la historia revolucionaria, la de presentacion del historial, la casa de cultura, la sala de divulgacion de los conocimientos cientifico-tecnicos y la casa de cura y descanso.
					
					El Mariscal aprecio el diseno y la calidad de obra de todos los edificios de produccion y vida y prometio a construir en el proximo ano las viviendas de los empleados de la empresa pesquera.
					
					El Mariscal dio instrucciones que serviran de guia en la administracion de la empresa.
					
					Recorrio con satisfaccion la Empresa Pesquera No. 15 del EPC, dijo y continuo que los asombrosos exitos logrados en este ano en la rama pesquera del EPC, le hacen mas firme la conviccion de que podran continuar la historia del mar de oro.
					
					Kim Jong Un expreso la esperanza y la conviccion de que tambien en el ano proximo los funcionarios y empleados de la Empresa Pesquera No. 15 del EPC se pondran a la cabeza de la materializacion de la politica pesquera del Partido pescando mucha cantidad de pescados y se fotografio junto a ellos.
					
					Le acompanaron el vicemariscal del EPC Hwang Pyong So, jefe de la Direccion Politica General del EPC, y el coronel general de las fuerzas armadas terrestres So Hong Chan, primer viceministro de las Fuerzas Armadas Populares.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un recibe mensaje enviado por el Presidente sirio
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un recibe mensaje enviado por el Presidente sirio
Pyongyang, 15 de diciembre (ACNC) -- El Presidente del Comite de Estado de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Jong Un, recibio un mensaje que le remitiera el dia 13 el Presidente de la Republica Arabe de Siria, Bashar al-Assad.
					La misiva sigue:
					
					Envio este mensaje a Su Excelencia recogiendo el alma del pueblo arabe sirio que comparte la tristeza con la Direccion de la RPDC y el amistoso pueblo coreano en el 5o aniversario de deceso de Su Excelencia Dirigente Kim Jong Il.
					
					En esta ocasion, recordamos las hazanas y grandes esfuerzos de Su Excelencia Dirigente quien en el tiempo de pruebas, condujo al pueblo coreano manteniendo firmemente su idea y linea y el principio de resistencia.
					
					El hizo gran aporte a la gran victoria alcanzada por la RPDC en la lucha para lograr el progreso y el desarrollo y defender el socialismo y la nacion.
					
					Deseamos que Vd. lleve a feliz termino la lucha por el partido, la revolucion, la patria y el pueblo, conducida por Su Excelencia Dirigente Kim Jong Il, eterno lider de su Partido, y la Revolucion Coreana cuya mision principal es verificar la independencia en el mundo entero.

articles.title: Delegacion de la cancilleria canadiense visita a la RPDC
articles.content:
Delegacion de la cancilleria canadiense visita a la RPDC
Pyongyang, 15 de diciembre (ACNC) -- La delegacion de la cancilleria canadiense, encabezada por Sarah Taylor, directora general para Asia del Norte y Oceania de los Asuntos Globales de Canada, visito del dia 13 al 15 a la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea.
					Durante su estancia, la delegacion realizo una visita de cortesia al viceministro de Relaciones Exteriores de la RPDC, Han Song Ryol, y se reunio con la directora de America del Norte del MINREX, Choe Son Hui, para debatir el problema de desarrollar las relaciones bilaterales conforme a la aspiracion y demanda de los pueblos de dos paises y los otros de interes mutuo como el caso del ciudadano canadiense Rim Hyon Su.
					
					La delegacion visito a Rim quien fue condenado a la pena de trabajo reeducativo perpetuo por el complot de subversion del Estado.

articles.title: Llegan a Pyongyang los familiares de relacionados con la lucha antijaponesa
articles.content:
Llegan a Pyongyang los familiares de relacionados con la lucha antijaponesa
Pyongyang, 15 de diciembre (ACNC) -- Con motivo del 5o aniversario de fallecimiento del Dirigente Kim Jong Il, llegaron el dia 15 a esta capital los familiares del martir revolucionario antijapones chino, Zhang Weihua y los chinos relacionados con la lucha revolucionaria antijaponesa, Chai Shiying, Jiang Zihua y Liu Tong-shi, y los otros del martir revolucionario antijapones coreano, Pak Kil Song, y la combatiente revolucionaria antijaponesa coreana, So Sun Ok, residentes en China, y el hombre relacionado en ultramar, Son Won Thae.
					Arribo el mismo dia la familia de Hu Zhenyi, chino relacionado con la lucha revolucionaria antijaponesa.

articles.title: Regresan Jonathan Powell y su comitiva
articles.content:
Regresan Jonathan Powell y su comitiva
Pyongyang, 15 de diciembre (ACNC) -- Jonathan Powell, ejecutor en jefe de la Inter-Mediacion, y su comitiva partieron el dia 15 de esta capital.

articles.title: Seleccionados mejores jugadores de 2016
articles.content:
Seleccionados mejores jugadores de 2016
Pyongyang, 15 de diciembre (ACNC) -- Fueron elegidos en Corea los mejores jugadores por disciplinas del 105 (2016) de la Era Juche.
					Ellos son Om Yun Chol (m) y Rim Jong Sim (f) en el levantamiento de pesas; Ri Se Gwang (m) en la gimnasia de aparatos; Kim Song I (f) en el tenis de mesa; Kim Song Guk (m) y Pak Myong Won (m) en el tiro; Pak Chol (m) y Kim Hye Song (f) en el maraton; Jon Chol (m) y Kang Un Ju (f) en el tiro al arco.
					
					Rim Jong Sim y Ri Se Gwang son medallistas de oro de los 31o Juegos Olimpicos en la division de 75kg de levantamiento de pesas y en el potro y Om Yun Chol conquisto presea de plata en la division de 56kg de levantamiento de pesas. Y Kim Song I y Kim Song Guk ocuparon tercer lugar en el juego individual de tenis de mesa y el tiro de pistola de 50m, respectivamente.
					
					En el Campeonato Mundial de Tiro de Blancos Moviles de 2016, Pak Myong Won se ubico en el segundo lugar en el tiro individual a los blancos moviles de 10m y el tiro mixto a los blancos moviles de 10m, respectivamente, y en el tercer lugar en el tiro mixto a los blancos moviles de 50m.
					
					Pak Chol gano medalla de oro en la Competencia Internacional de Maraton por el Premio Mangyongdae y Kim Hye Song, presea de plata en el semi-maraton de la Competencia de Carrera Femenina de Singapur 2016.
					
					Jon Chol y Kang Un Ju establecieron nuevos recordes nacionales en el Torneo Deportivo por el Premio Mangyongdae, la Competencia Deportiva por el Premio Antorcha de Pochonbo y la XIII Competencia Deportiva del Pueblo que tuvieron lugar este ano.
